column4: im not sure what im missing but I cannot for the life of me burn a bootable cd in ubuntu
moreover, I dont know how to check outside of a virtual machine and im tired of wasting time and blank discs
however the iso does mount in ubuntu just fine, I just cant get it to be bootable
i also tried burning it like a should burn an image
and extracting the source daa and making a new iso

im stuck, i need to have xp on here tomorrow, I really didnt think it was going to be this complicated, but i do not know how to make it bootable, check if its bootable, so i have to burn it every time i try something new, and its an os so I cant really burn at a good speed or anything...
sorry enter thing again lol, yea i burned all of my tests tonight at under 4x
did you first check the iso against the md5 ?
and have you tried burning other iso ?
anythin other than the one you are having problems with (preferrabley one that is bootable )
you need to first 1) try burn another iso image that would be bootable and determine that your cd/dvd drive isn't on its way out
also this is verging on offtopic
i burned a debian iso tonight, and that worked great, and i ask here because i need to know how to check if an iso is bootable, and how to make it bootable if it isnt, in ubuntu
ok then , from memory there are several tools in the ubuntu repositories for editing normal iso images
